page.title: 09MUSHROOM FARMING
page.content: MUSHROOM FARMING (continued from pg 8) Mr. Nutting sells his mushrooms in a 30 mile radius of his farm, most going to shops in Gloucester City. He uses an old Walls Ice Cream van for transporting them. The price of mushrooms varies according to the season but the selling price in the shops is generally about Â£1.25 per pound. Mr. Nutting employs 24 workers. They travel to work by bike, motor-bike and car. They work about 50 hours per week doing the routine jobs. Mr. Nutting decides what needs doing. He grows about 200,000 Kg of mushrooms a year but a lot is lost due to mice. The only other real pest is the mushroom fly which is controlled with pesticides.
